reports.summary: This is NOT correct. It's always been 3->5. The sound on the record is from the note going from 3, to 5, back to 3 because of how fast they're playing. It sounds like a 3-5-3 hopo really fast but its just suppose to be 3-5 only.

description:
- Made the slight fix to the descending harmonics on Measure 144 mentioned by Evan Hooper
- Adjusted Dave's Solo (Measure 199 - 200) as suggested by Joseph
- Removed Sander's error report because Lem fixed the intro in his most recent revision
title: Holy Wars... The Punishment Due

description: Corrected the intro. This is from Dave Mustaine himself (https://twitter.com/DaveMustaine/status/838376983042142208/photo/1?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw), so please don't change it again.
title: Holy Wars... The Punishment Due

description:
- Added the two palm-muted notes at the beginning of each "Punishment Due" verse. 
- Added the key for Marty's first solo.
- Made a minor fix in Marty's first solo.
title: Holy Wars... The Punishment Due

description: Fixed both of Dave's parts during Marty's solos as according to the solo guitar track. Also added the names of the arpeggios Dave is playing. Changed the alteration between power chords and thirds starting at measure 189 for Marty. Also named the key Marty's second solo is in.
title: Holy Wars... The Punishment Due

description: the rhythm part at friedman's solo 3 wasnt correct, so i updated it.
title: Holy Wars... The Punishment Due

description: Made the time signature changes suggested by Calcon.
title: Holy Wars... The Punishment Due

description:
Fixed the time signature in the intro and during the first verse. Made all the Solos a louder dynamic so you you can actually hear them.
 In "The Punishment Due" section, fixed the open string riff that is major thirds instead of power chords (watch any of the lessons he's given or their live shows). Did the same for a similar section in the Holy Wars intro/pre-verse. 
Changed the fingering for Dave's Lead during Holy Wars.
And added a couple more markers and changed them to a more readable colour.
title: Holy Wars... The Punishment Due

description: You can't change the instruments just because you think it has a "better sound" if those instruments are incorrect. The bass is played with a pick, and that is the way it shall be, and the interlude is played on an acoustic guitar.
